bibl.title: Multitextuality in the Homeric Iliad. The Witness of the Ptolemaic Papyri.
bibl.note: 1. Textual Criticism as Applied to Classical and Biblical Texts. - 2. Homer and Textual Criticism. - 3. The Ptolemaic Papyri of the Iliad: Evidence of Eccentricity or Multitextuality? - Appendix A: Other Instances of Multitextuality; - Appendix B: Glossary of Terms. - Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: Graeme D. Bird, Multitextuality in the Homeric Iliad. The Witness of the Ptolemaic Papyri = Hellenic Studies. 43.
Washington, D.C., Center for Hellenic Studies - Cambridge, Mass. - London (Diffusion: Harvard University Press), 2010, 8°, 119 pp., tabl., 3 diagrammes, 4 figg. ISBN 978-0-674-05323-6. $19.95.

1. Textual Criticism as Applied to Classical and Biblical Texts. - 2. Homer and Textual Criticism. - 3. The Ptolemaic Papyri of the Iliad: Evidence of Eccentricity or Multitextuality? - Appendix A: Other Instances of Multitextuality; - Appendix B: Glossary of Terms. - Bibliography. Index.
C.R. par Antony Makrinos, CR N.S., 62 (2012) pp. 8-10. - Adrian Kelly, JHS 134 (2014) pp. 150-151.
